page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This block of land is definitely rural England influenced by the fact that it almost all was or is part of the Longleat Estat. Its proximity to Warminster and the Army there make it a desirable rural residential area. One major road crosses it:- the A360 Warminster to Shaftesbury, following the Wylye Valley. most of the area is woodland and pasture. Crockerton is a scattered village with no particular centre. Shearwater is a local beauty spot for walking, riding, fishing and sailing. An out-of-town shopping and garden centre has grown where an old brick works used to be, by the river. The village school thrives in Crockerton but the church and two chapels are closed. Longbridge Deverill Church, which is just in this block is open but the school is now the village hall.
